守护者秩序，这些禁欲者隔离危险的魔法并防止超自然灾难
永恒秩序的卡迪娜·阿塔扎斯
英格丽德·范·里希滕博士，一位学究型的灵魂，她出没于里瓦利斯附近的里希滕府邸
雷氏代理机构，总部位于马提拉湾的调查员
斯凯弗，阿扎林的{@creature 小恶魔}宠物
table.name: 绝望的盟友与对手; 达克龙盟友

table.caption: 达克龙对手
rows: 阿尔西奥·梅图斯和卡加特
达卡尔鲁斯·雷克斯和永恒秩序
塔利斯维里夫人·艾瑞斯和家族
埃巴斯希斯，阿扎林的黑色阴影龙顾问
被诅咒的神器，存放在守护者秩序的修道院内
阿扎林的影子，达克领主的回声
table.name: 绝望的盟友与对手; 达克龙对手

table.caption: 达克龙的恐惧
rows: 一个预言预示了角色们在达克龙的救赎或毁灭中的参与，并且带有八个不可避免的征兆。
角色们参与了升华时刻，并共享了一个黑暗礼物（见{@book 第1章|VRGR|1}）。
其中一位角色是成为新黑暗领主或阿扎林重生的完美容器。
队伍被迫与一个邪恶存在合作，这个存在来自达克龙对手表或另一个黑暗领主。
达克龙的死者希望帮助角色们，以不断增长的军团形式聚集到他们身边。
角色们遭受绝望、支离破碎的梦境，这些梦境来自神秘的盟友或他们未来的自己，警告他们即将发生的灾难。
table.name: 达克龙的恐惧

table.caption: 达克龙终章
rows: 阿扎林的潜在继承人都不适合成为黑暗领主。只有通过合并他们的灵魂或使一个继承人成为隐藏邪恶的容器，新的黑暗领主才能出现。
国王之泪是一个地牢大小的琥珀蛹，阿扎林正在用它来创造一个新的黑暗力量。角色们必须找到黑色阴影龙埃巴斯希斯，并说服她帮助潜入这座漂浮的建筑，并从内部将其击碎。
阿扎林相信，逃离恐惧领域的唯一方法是破坏它们的枢纽：第一个领域，巴洛维亚。他已经逃离了达克龙，但他计划的下一步必须被阻止，否则他将摧毁所有的领域。
阿扎林的每位继承人都持有黑暗领主王冠的一部分。收集这些碎片并将它们带到阿弗纳斯城堡，可以恢复阿扎林或使新黑暗领主升位。
其中一位角色是阿扎林的克隆体，作为潜在的黑暗领主被创造出来，这样真正的阿扎林就可以逃脱。升华时刻是一个分散黑暗力量注意力的幌子。
阿扎林改变了时间，使他从未成为黑暗领主。角色们必须跟随阿扎林回到他的过去，并确保他的行为引起黑暗力量的注意。
table.name: 达克龙的最终命运; 达克龙终章

table.caption: 德门特琉冒险
rows: 一位刺耳的女高音在Port-a-Lucine歌剧院的新制作中担任主演。嫉妒的女歌唱家们雇佣了这个团队，来弄清楚她使用了什么魔法来迷惑她的方式获得这个角色。
一位来自Phlegethan医院的病人联系了这个团队，声称自己是真正的德昂奈尔公爵。他有一种超自然的能耐，能够使他人屈服于他的意志。
这个团队与城市警卫发生了冲突，并得知他们的队长已经被一个恶魔取代，这个恶魔正在将他们转变为一支残暴的力量。
人们正被逼真的构造体所取代，而原版的人质被关押在亚历山大·杜·西尔的蜡像馆下的地窖里。团队中的一个成员是下一个目标。
一位追捕红死病的十字军被谋杀了。凶手不是红死病，而是最近一位受害者的家人，他们不希望受害者的贫穷和谎言被揭露。
一位自称是公爵夫人赛德拉继姐的女子来到镇上，并且谨慎地询问如何最好地揭露关于公爵夫人的可怕真相：她是一个出身卑微的骗子。
table.name: 德门特留的冒险; 德门特琉冒险

table.caption: 大假面舞会目标
rows: 在假面舞会上找到一个特定的贵族，并从他们那里获取信息（或向他们提供信息）。
阻止一个恶棍在假面舞会上犯罪。
为了从三奇顶的巫婆那里得到一个好处，完成一个微不足道的任务，比如在壁炉架上留下一个小饰品或者偷一个水果塔。
保护另一位与会者，确保那个人不会被暗杀...或者被揭穿身份。
利用人群向人们传播解药、诅咒或重要信息。
确保与德昂奈尔公爵夫人私下会面。
table.name: 盛大的化装舞会; 大假面舞会目标

table.caption: 大假面舞会复杂情况
rows: 一个穿着与角色相同服装的愤怒客人指控他们窃取了这个创意。
一个爱调情的客人决定这些有趣的角色应该被介绍给城市精英。
拥有最高被动智慧（{@skill 感知}）得分的角色注意到一个手指灵巧的客人从他们的舞伴身上偷走一条项链。
一个醉酒的客人大声说出其他人假装没听到的真相。
从庄园的另一个部分传来的尖叫声划破了空气。每个人都安静了一会儿，然后立刻继续进行，就好像什么也没发生过一样。
公爵夫人赛德拉进入房间，马屁精们立刻围了上去。
table.name: 随机复杂情况; 大假面舞会复杂情况

table.caption: 法尔科维尼亚冒险
rows: 派对发现了一个城镇，在那里{@creature 僵尸||僵尸}开始表现出奇怪的行为：耕田、在商店里逗留，并聚集在破败的寺庙里。是什么导致了这种奇怪的行为？
在莫芬齐，弗恩·霍斯特曼设想了一支野兽般的超级士兵军队。他致力于完善他所谓的“原始血清”，这是一种使注射者患上随机形式的狼人病的药剂。他企图将角色们作为试验对象。
一场瘟疫袭击了莱卡尔的贫民窟。死于这种疾病的人变成了{@creature Zombie Plague Spreader|VRGR|5|僵尸瘟疫传播者}（见{@book 第五章|VRGR|5}）。
一群僵尸动物——主要是狼、乌鸦和牛——攻击来自莱卡尔的工作队伍和路上的幸存者。角色们被招募来担任守卫。
角色们被派去调查一颗坠落的星星，它坠落在德尔门斯特村附近。这个村庄异常平静，没有僵尸，这在很大程度上是因为它的居民是{@creature bodytaker plant|VRGR}的{@creature Podling|VRGR|5|豆荚灵}（见{@book 第五章|VRGR|5}）。
一个角色得知一个有影响力的爪牙计划在下一次僵尸攻击莱卡尔时通过破坏城市的防御并允许僵尸进入堡垒区来推翻德拉科夫将军。
吉姆森草，一个在西尔伯瓦斯的幸存者团队，在试图掠夺德科万宫殿后消失了。不久之后，宫殿的奇怪光芒出现在那些曾经被失踪的幸存者占据的建筑物中。
一位名叫贡德加尔的骑士攻击了爪牙巡逻队，并声称她能带领普通人到一个安全的避难所。跟随她的人再也没有出现过。爪牙雇佣了派对去追捕这位骑士。
角色们得知莱卡尔的一些受压迫的市民正在策划在下一次僵尸围攻后逃入迷雾中。这些市民是绝望的非战斗人员，还是试图引出“叛徒”的爪牙特工？
在新月之夜，莱卡尔的城墙上没有出现僵尸大军。相反，一个亡灵使者带着一封给德拉科夫将军的信件抵达。
table.name: 在法尔科尼亚的冒险; 法尔科维尼亚冒险

table.caption: 僵尸围攻遭遇
rows: 僵尸撕碎了一名士兵，导致附近的人僵立不动或逃跑。
平民逃离战场。一个爪牙攻击他们，杀死逃兵以阻止进一步的逃亡。
一名爪牙信使，携带德拉科夫将军的命令，努力到达一个被围困的城门。
一名惊慌失措的爪牙法师鲁莽地施放破坏性法术，连僵尸和士兵都被法术效果波及。
一群平民试图逃离城市，揭示了城墙中的一个隐藏缺口。
僵尸的尸体堆积起来，形成了通往城墙某段的逐渐增高的斜坡。
僵尸挖掘穿过或在墙下，使它们能够持续不断地流入城市。
僵尸引发攻城武器向城市开火或引发一场大火。
在爪牙牧师用来治疗伤员的建筑物中爆发了战斗。
僵尸突破了城门，开始攀登城门后的吊闸。
僵尸潜入下水道，并出现在城市中一个本应安全的区域。
大量僵尸或防御者的计划失败导致城墙或塔楼倒塌。
table.name: 在围攻期间; 僵尸围攻遭遇

table.caption: 僵尸围城高潮
rows: 僵尸通过破坏河流栅栏，通过扎帕诺斯特河涌入城市。德拉科夫下令将数千加仑的油倒入下水道并点燃。僵尸被烧毁，但火焰吞噬了各个区域，河流也被污染了。
北区将会被淹没。德拉科夫计划使用爆炸性粉末桶来炸毁过河的桥梁。这将阻止僵尸，但也会困住许多士兵和平民在另一边。
德拉科夫计划打开几个城门，让僵尸进入一个人口密集的区域。当僵尸进食时，这个区域将被点燃。
德拉科夫的部队围捕平民并将他们赶出城市，分散了僵尸的注意力。这使得爪牙能够加强防御并击退第二次，较为分散的僵尸攻击。
table.name: 围城结束; 僵尸围城高潮

table.caption: 哈'阿基尔冒险
rows: Ese的祭司们寻求冒险家从迷宫中救回他们曾经谴责的人。
历史学家卡拉菲克挖掘了一个布满密封坟墓的峡谷。她支付给劳工丰厚的报酬，但也利用他们承受墓穴隐藏的诅咒的主要冲击。
在河之庇护所定居的隐士无意中揭示了一个墓穴，并释放了因被打扰而怀恨在心的{@creature Mummy||木乃伊}。
一位前高级祭司的金字塔消失了。内布的祭司们寻求帮助，在法老注意到并感到不快之前找到这座纪念碑。
斯内夫鲁，奥鲁的一位祭司，发现弯曲金字塔对歌声有反应。她寻求帮助，组织一个庞大的合唱团来开启一条内部通道。
革命家阿利兹实际上是一个与{@creature 木乃伊领主}森梅特结盟的豺狼头{@creature 狼人}。她试图找到安赫特波特的卡（ka），以结束法老的统治。
苏特之选寻求帮助，拯救在被遗忘者的呼吸中失踪的旅行者。队伍必须经受住神的考验，才能从风暴中拯救他们。
内菲尔，一个猫头的安克特波特之子，抵达了穆哈尔。为了激励活着的人找到法老的失落宝藏，她每在这座城市度过一天，就会在每个黎明诅咒与她在城市中度过的天数相等的无辜者。
table.name: 哈阿基尔的冒险; 哈'阿基尔冒险

table.caption: 安赫特波特的灵魂
rows: 一只不知疲倦地绕着太阳盘旋的{@creature 鹰}或{@creature 巨型鹰}。
一个藏有法老心脏的卡诺皮克罐，隐藏在一个被遗忘的坟墓中
木乃伊化并分割的心肉，其中一块隐藏在每个仍然忠诚的安赫特波特的子嗣中
对那些在被遗忘者的呼吸和虚假者的呼吸中存活下来的人所赐予的祝福
一组对哈'阿基尔的古老神祇神圣的遗迹
穆哈尔人民唱出的一首欢乐之歌的体现
一个无辜治疗者的灵魂，他与法老生前的样子相似
一个角色的灵魂，可能是一个拥有回响灵魂（在《危险之地》第1章中详细描述的黑暗礼物）的角色
table.name: 灵魂的形状; 安赫特波特的灵魂

table.caption: 寻找卡的行动
rows: 角色们引起了大祭司雷赫特普的注意，她要求他们帮助她找到法老的失落宝藏，否则将面临惩罚。
不满祭司和法老的革命者寻找安克特波特的失落宝藏，希望获得对统治者的影响力。
哈阿基尔的斯芬克斯知道安克特波特快要找到他失去的卡了。他们希望先找到它，并将之置于黑暗领主触及不到的地方。
安克特波特之子，无论是像内菲尔这样的忠诚仆人还是像森梅特这样的叛徒，都指派角色们寻找失落的卡以实现他们自己的目的。
角色们在墓穴中发现的壁画或象形文字指向其他遗迹，每个遗迹都携带着找到法老失踪宝藏的线索。
角色们死后，法老安克特波特将他们复活（可能是重生；见《危险之地》第1章|VRGR|1|重生）。他们继续存在是有条件的，那就是寻找并找到他的卡。
table.name: 猎人的角色; 寻找卡的行动

table.caption: 安克特波特重生
rows: 安克特波特现在是凡人，但保留了他所有的超自然能力。这位暴君重新焕发活力，更积极地参与哈阿基尔的统治，沉溺于奢华之中，并强迫人民为他新发现的荣耀建造巨大的纪念碑。
安克特波特只是短暂地成为凡人。他的身体迅速衰败，使他回到了不死状态。愤怒之下，他释放了他的不死军团，意图将哈阿基尔转变为他自己创造的来世。
安克特波特重生后不久便永远死去。剩下的安克特波特之子相互对立，每个人都自称为法老安克特波特二世。
安克特波特重生，死去，再次被神诅咒，并被锁在一个隐藏的墓穴中。随着土地被争吵的木乃伊、徒劳的革命和严酷的风暴所蹂躏，哈阿基尔陷入了混乱。只有将安克特波特重新掌权，这片土地才能得救。
table.name: 法老的归来; 安克特波特重生

table.caption: 哈兹兰冒险
rows: 哈兹利克的学徒艾莱尼对古老的白化{@creature purple worm} 格雷达因克施展了魔法，将其作为对抗任何反对她主人的人的武器。当这只蠕虫摆脱了她的控制时，艾莱尼寻求帮助重新捕获它，以免哈兹利克发现。
被抛弃的魔法创造物遍布被称为“痴迷之终”的干涸湖床。一个有智慧的战争机器或一个{@creature 铁魔像}逃离了垃圾堆，并请求队伍帮助它找到过上平凡生活的方法。
无数的{@creature 格瑞米什卡|VRGR|gremishkas}（见{@book 第五章|VRGR|5|Gremishka}）聚集在被称为啃食之路的洞穴中。这些生物密谋要压倒斯莱-瓦尔，并且在此过程中会穿过托亚利斯。两个社区的成员请求灭害者。
围绕着哲学家之卵，一个八层高的黄水晶蛋，坐落在名为沸腾的地区的台地上，形成了一个邪教。邪教徒们寻找一个从未被魔法触碰过的人来释放其中未出生的反魔法实体。
哈兹利克的一个学徒派出了多个小组去捕获一个从月石谷陨石中出现的{@b 星裔使者}（见《第5章|VRGR|5|星裔使者}）。但这个变形者消失了，在可能的捕获者中潜行。
哈兹利克的一个学徒渴望探索被称为贪食壶的无底洞。他需要一个测试团队来试用他设计的穿越不可能距离的车辆。
一个有魔法天赋的平民被绑架，被迫成为巫师的学徒。他们的家人雇佣角色们去救回他们，但被绑架者很快就适应了不道德巫师的堕落生活。
哈兹兰上空的月亮破碎并向地面坠落。无论是由于一个强大的咒语出错还是一个横跨整个领域的幻象，这个景象使托亚利斯陷入混乱。居民们要求角色们帮助他们逃离这场灾难。
哈兹利克的一个学徒需要代理人去搜寻据说在被称为酿造之地的沼泽中无数魔法毒素中形成的疑似青春之泉。
哈兹利克知道他的领域时日无多。他试图利用角色们重新创造最初将他带到哈兹兰的活体传送门，无论是作为其创造者还是其原材料。
table.name: 哈兹兰冒险

table.caption: 哈兹兰野魔法
rows: 角色触发了来自《玩家手册》中《野魔法涌动》表的随机效果。
角色在他们的下一回合结束前对所有生物感到{@condition 惊恐}。

A number ({@dice 2d4}) of the Staring Cats of Uldun-dar appear within 30 feet of the character. These sapient, hyperdimensional {@creature Cat||cats} have uneven numbers of eyes and are not hostile, but they ominously share reports on how the character died in multiple parallel dimensions. The cats vanish after the character's next long rest.
角色和离他们最近的生物都被传送到距离60英尺内的随机空闲位置，由DM选择。当他们重新出现时，他们身上覆盖着无害的外质。
角色在1轮内广播他们的表面思想，就好像所有30英尺范围内的生物都对他们施放了{@spell detect thoughts}。
一个哈兹利克的幽灵之眼出现，悬浮在角色上方1小时。这个眼睛的功能在“{@book 哈兹利克之眼|VRGR|3|哈兹利克之眼}”部分中有详细描述。
一个类似于由{@spell arcane gate}创造的传送门在角色10英尺范围内打开。它连接到哈兹兰某处的另一个传送门。传送门保持开启1小时，在此期间，来自任一侧的生物都可以穿过。
一个尖叫的、无皮的、多肢的恐怖生物出现在角色30英尺内，它具有（并且模糊地类似于）{@creature 独角兽}的统计数据。它对角色怀有敌意，1分钟后消失。
角色将自己作为中心，使用魅力作为施法能力，施放了一个5级法术{@spell 火球术}。火焰中传来尖叫声和笑声。
一团雾云出现在角色中心。这个效果类似于一个{@spell 雾云术}法术，持续时间为10分钟。地下城主可以选择让雾影响生物，就好像它们进入了迷雾之中。
table.name: 哈兹兰野魔法

table.caption: 伊卡斯冒险
rows: 一位绝望的当地人需要药物来治疗生病的配偶，但是在怀惠中心唯一拥有必需草药的商人要求用宝石花园的新鲜水果交换。这位当地人恳求角色们潜入闹鬼的公园（见{@book 第五章|VRGR|5}）。
伊卡斯街头有一个孩子失踪了。孩子的父母恳求角色们在黄昏前找到这个年轻人。
一个被称为伊卡斯梦境城市中罪犯的{@creature 间谍}被监禁，每次他入睡时都会受到折磨。他请求角色们的帮助，以保持清醒。
一群{@creature 强盗}在他们的领地内伏击任何经过的人，要求提供新鲜肉类以换取通行。被困的当地人寻求帮助，以通过这个帮派的领地。
一位忧郁的精灵无法进入齐昂·张的梦境与家人团聚。他恳求角色们帮助他找到方法。
一个{@creature 僵尸|VRGR}接近角色们，并请求他们帮助在梦境城市中找到她失去的一个或多个家庭成员。她担心家人的下落——他们的身体应该在城市中，但她已经失去了他们的踪迹。
在大厦区（Mansions）的一个家庭为了安抚一个饥饿的{@creature 鬼魂}，提供了食物和追忆作为祭品。这吸引了其他几十个鬼魂。这个家庭寻求帮助以安抚他们无法养活的亡灵之口。
崔香的图书馆位于骨宫之中，藏有关于梦境与现实边界的秘密。角色们必须潜入宫殿，找到他们需要的信息，并在黎明前崔香返回之前逃脱。
一个绝望的{@creature veteran}从梦中醒来，并试图点燃I'Cath，认为一切都应该被焚烧，总比生活在谎言中要好。角色们必须选择如何应对这个杀人放火的纵火犯。
齐天昌的所有女儿中，除了一个外都失踪了——剩下的女儿要么是齐天秀梅，要么是齐天雷安，她们俩都不能说话。这个女儿在队伍的路径上出现，并默默地请求帮助。
table.name: 伊卡斯冒险

table.caption: 卡拉克里冒险
rows: {@creature 强盗||强盗们}占领了尼拉库林奇村，声称拉姆雅或阿里雅尼是他们的领袖。实际上，他们并不效忠于任何一方，而是在利用那些害怕不服从派系的人进行机会主义抢劫。一个逃脱的村民恳求角色们提供帮助。
自称知晓宗教启蒙之路的{@creature 石巨人}导师贾伦杜。那些未能证明自己对他教义的虔诚的人最终会{@condition 石化}。
在被称为沉没祭坛的古老沉没遗迹周围，海水沸腾。由于不断的动荡，没有人执行过必要的仪式来安抚深渊中居住的生物。
数十名仆人被雇佣来帮助举办阿里雅尼举办的盛大晚会。活动非常成功，但没有任何一名仆人返回家中。他们的家人恳求角色们寻找答案。
稀有的拉尔瓦尼香料具有神奇的药用特性，但根据皇家法令，它只在天蓝堡垒的花园里种植。神秘的{@creature 鬼}商人埃斯塔万愿意为这种香料支付好价钱，并且为种子支付更多的钱。
一位家长请求角色们将他们离家出走的孩子带回家，却不知道他们的孩子加入了拉姆雅的军队，死去了，并以{@creature 亡灵}的身份返回。
里瓦雇佣队伍去寻找据说位于阿什瓦甘加山脉某处的禁忌废墟巴胡鲁。她相信她的祖先在那里囚禁了一个强大的力量，她希望能够唤醒并使其为自己服务。
米娜卡拉人的影子正在消失，失去影子的人很快就会生病并死亡。一位当地领袖声称，这种奇怪瘟疫的治愈方法隐藏在被称为尼兰詹修道院的岛屿上（在本章后面的“其他恐怖领域”中有详细描述）。
一位{@creature 平民}恳求角色们证明他们兄弟姐妹对拉姆雅的忠诚。时间紧迫，因为兄弟姐妹被逮捕并被带到叛徒之塔，面临处决。
拉姆雅希望有一个配偶来巩固她的统治，并给王国带来稳定。一个有能力的战士引起了她的注意。
table.name: 卡拉克里冒险

table.caption: 卡塔卡斯冒险
rows: 角色们抵达卡塔卡斯，立即遇到了一个友好的当地人：哈肯·卢卡斯。
一个敌人携带着哈莫尼亚水晶俱乐部的邀请函。如果角色们前往访问，他们会发现自己是人群中唯一的非狼人。
在梅德里亚，一位舞台布景师在舞台制作中使用了“驯服的”{@creature Mimic||拟态怪}。现在观众被困在被这些怪物占据的剧院里。
派对调查了发生在埃姆赫斯特的一起谋杀案。受害者是一名演员，他在持续上演的沉浸式戏剧中扮演的角色每天都会被谋杀。
阿克里尔·卢卡斯雇佣派对“借用”她父亲的小提琴，这样她就可以根据它精确地仿制自己的小提琴，破碎之心。
一位名叫拉达加的学者寻求角色们的帮助，以从马尔特洛山的骷髅出没的峡谷中回收一件神秘的遗物——一顶古老的王冠。
派对受邀参加在被称为地下墓穴的山丘上举行的格斗锦标赛。到达后，他们发现是由{@creature Goblin||地精}在华丽的{@creature gladiator}尼姆·皮姆普利的监督下组织的活动。
哈莫尼亚的一位酿酒师雇佣派对运送一车米库布拉——一种当地浆果酒，可以舒缓喉咙并改善声乐表演。一伙小偷劫持了最后两次送货，酿酒师希望确保这次最新的送货能够到达买家哈肯·卢卡斯手中。
table.name: 卡塔卡斯冒险

table.caption: 哈肯·卢卡斯的恩惠
rows: 哈肯预计将首次演出一首新歌《Just Like the Wind》，但他的伴唱演员和随行人员都失踪了。黑暗领主请求角色们临时充当表演者和个人保安。
哈肯预计在公共活动中会被一个有毒的前学生或情人攻击。黑暗领主请求派对拦截这个跟踪者。
哈肯假装害怕被粉丝围堵。黑暗领主请求派对为他伪装并护送他到一个活动。
在野外，哈肯的随行人员被狼或强盗杀害。如果派对救了他，黑暗领主假装无助，并请求与他们同行。
table.name: 遇见黑暗领主; 哈肯·卢卡斯的恩惠

table.caption: 拉莫迪亚冒险
rows: 有智慧的实验室动物从卢登多夫大学逃脱，需要帮助找到新家。然而，其中一只渴望改善自己的形态以及同伴们的形态。
医学生埃米尔·博伦巴赫努力制造革命性的{@creature Flesh Golem||血肉魔像}，比如完全由{@creature Doppelganger||变形怪}或{@creature Beholder||巨眼怪}制成的魔像。他的赞助人招募队伍来帮助他的研究。
一只杀人的、黄疸的鲸鱼正在猎捕卢登多夫的船只。城市海军的迷信船长弗施特请求队伍通过寻找冬季之口——一个冰面上的裂缝，据说海洋在那里低语其秘密——来了解原因。
卢登多夫大学的三名杰出学生竞争成为莫登海姆博士的新助手。每个人都寻求队伍的帮助，以确保他们被选为这个机会。
一波扭曲的怪物正准备袭击诺伊弗尔赫特堡。吉斯布雷希特自动武器公司的冶金学家们创造了一种新武器或车辆，可能可以拯救这个城镇，但他们需要有人来测试它。
鲁普雷希特·沙勒本将继承他在卢登多夫垂死的父亲的工厂。相反，乌多·沙勒雇佣了刺客谋杀了他的儿子，并将他的大脑移植到鲁普雷希特年轻的身体中，这得到了莫登海姆博士的帮助。乌多的女儿和唯一的幸存继承人，瓦里萨·沙勒，想要为她兄弟的谋杀复仇，并恳求队伍帮助摧毁她的父亲。
寻找稀有气体口袋的勘探者发现了众多保存完好的泥沼木乃伊，这些木乃伊可以追溯到拉莫迪亚古代的德鲁伊人。当木乃伊消失，不死动物开始恐吓他们的营地时，他们寻求帮助。
奥布雷克男爵写信给队伍，请求他们从“亲戚”的身体中恢复过来，这个“亲戚”位于海鱼号——一艘被冰柱刺穿的沉船上。
沉睡的野兽正经历着越来越多的地震。普尔斯泰因矿的监管者请求援助，他们认为奇怪的生物正在引起地震，以窃取他们正在开采的“骨髓石”。
卢登多夫大学的学者们得知了不碎之心，并声称一个怪物偷走了它。角色和其他数十名猎人被派往痛苦群岛去回收这个装置。
table.name: 在拉莫迪亚的冒险; 拉莫迪亚冒险

table.caption: 服务莫登海姆博士
rows: 博士渴望从诺伊弗尔赫特堡的一家工厂获得尖端发现。为了获得它，她绑架了工厂老板的家人，并将角色们的意识放入他们的身体中。直到角色们交付这一发现，她才会保留他们的身体和家族的大脑在冷藏库中。
莫登海姆博士想要监视卢登多夫大学，于是将角色们的头部安装在{@creature animated armor}（活化盔甲）上。角色们在带回博士所需的信息后将恢复他们的身体。
奥布雷克男爵的代理人攻击了莫登海姆城堡并造成了相当大的破坏。莫登海姆博士将角色们的大脑放入{@creature Flesh Golem||血肉魔像}中，并释放它们去惩罚男爵。
莫登海姆博士想要找到并带回{@creature Elise|VRGR}。她使用各种怪物的部件，创造了具有{@creature Flesh Golem||血肉魔像}或其他怪物统计数据的独特猎人身体。她将角色们的意识放入这些身体中，并承诺在他们将{@creature Elise|VRGR}带给她时恢复他们。
table.name: 莫登海姆的设计; 服务莫登海姆博士

table.caption: 莫登特冒险
rows: 一位炼金术士发现了一种将灵魂“燃烧”以提供魔法火焰燃料的方法。几个灵魂寻求队伍的帮助，以防止他们的第二次死亡。
一位{@creature noble}（贵族）寻求帮助，因为一位不死的祖先试图阻止贵族与一个"不合适"的伴侣结婚。
两个因家族阻挠而未能结合的恋人的灵魂开始向活人复仇。
一对敌对的恶魔，阿多斯和迪切，从石楠屋收藏中的雕像里逃脱。韦瑟梅家族的成员请求援助。
克劳福德村的居民们流传着关于一只巨大{@creature 乌鸦}的故事。警长珀金斯雇佣角色们去猎杀这个生物，它实际上是一个{@creature 狼人乌鸦|VRGR}（见{@book 第5章|VRGR|5}）在保护社区免受更大的威胁。
西科特庄园已经遭受诅咒一百年了。周围的沼泽地侵蚀着这座房子，嚎叫的沼泽猎犬越来越接近庄园备受困扰的领主。
一个小庄园的准男爵被迫每天犯下越来越严重的罪行，否则将面临他那些同样遭受过相同诅咒的幽灵祖先的难以言说的折磨。
有人重建了那个臭名昭著的装置，并且正在使用它将恶毒的灵魂转移到莫登特郡温顺市民的身体里。
table.name: 在莫登特的冒险; 莫登特冒险

table.caption: 鬼魂的历史
rows: 这个鬼魂死得如此之近，以至于他们可能还没有完全意识到自己已经死了。
这个鬼魂死得足够近，以至于那些在生前认识他们的人仍然在世。
这个鬼魂在多年前就去世了，而且现在认识他们的人已经很少还活着。
这个鬼魂是一代人之前去世的；人们记得关于这个人生活的谣言或故事。
这个鬼魂在数代人之前就已经去世，只有当地的民间传说或历史记载保留了他们的记忆。
这个鬼魂死去了很久远的年代，没有人知道关于他们的任何历史。
table.name: 属性检定:历史; 鬼魂的历史

table.caption: 悲剧元素
rows: 这个鬼魂因心碎而痛苦。
这个鬼魂干扰了他们受害者的爱情生活。
这个鬼魂被错误地指控并定罪于一项罪行。
这个鬼魂使一个无辜的人看起来像是鬼魂所犯罪行的罪魁祸首。
在生前，这个鬼魂被家庭成员切断了联系，并被剥夺了合法的继承权。
这个鬼魂拒绝承认任何活着的继承人为其家庭成员，并试图阻止这些继承人继承他们应得的东西。
在生前，社会对这个鬼魂进行了不公正的排斥。
与这个鬼魂的关联导致他们活着的受害者被社会排斥。
在生前，鬼魂为了做好事而被巫婆、恶魔或强大的灵魂诅咒。
鬼魂挫败了他们受害者做好事的努力。
table.name: 悲剧元素

table.caption: 浪漫元素
rows: 这个鬼魂希望与另一个鬼魂重聚——他们生前所爱之人的灵魂。
这个鬼魂缠绕着他们在生前所爱的人，而那个人仍然回报着这份爱。
这个鬼魂出没于他们生前所爱的地方，或许是他们的家或对他们失去的人的纪念地。
这个鬼魂缠绕着他们在生前所爱的人，而那个人正试图继续前进。
这个鬼魂缠绕着一个长得像他们在生前所爱的人的人（可能是那个人的后代）。
一个生前爱过这个鬼魂的人拒绝让这个灵魂离开。
这个鬼魂在生前被他们所爱的人谋杀了。
这个鬼魂寻求对生前拒绝他们的人进行复仇。
table.name: 浪漫元素

table.caption: 里歇穆洛冒险
rows: 在杰奎琳·雷尼埃的命令下，{@creature 老鼠群||swarms of rats}每晚潜入家中并杀害家猫。心烦意乱的宠物主人恳求角色们提供帮助。
一位绝望的流氓在她的团队被困在废弃的菲奥克斯庄园内由一个失控的安全系统时，寻求角色们的帮助。
一群学生在被称为刺客回声的山谷中策划一场针对杰奎琳·雷尼埃的革命。他们确信其中一人是叛徒，但没有意识到他们中间有一只{@creature 狼人鼠}。
一位警官请求角色们帮助解决谋杀案，其中受害者的血液被吸干。凶手是一个{@creature strigoi|VRGR}（见{@book 第5章|VRGR|5}），它出没在沼泽中的一个被称为花园的沉没教堂里。
莫尔蒂尼的特马托医生相信她能够研制出治疗啃噬瘟疫的药物，并招募角色们寻找从未患过这种疾病的对象。不久，有关医生和角色实际上是在传播瘟疫的谣言开始传播。
路易丝·雷尼埃寻求角色们的帮助，潜入杰奎琳在德兰努特城堡举行的舞会。她的目的是激怒杰奎琳，以便她在客人面前暴露她的{@creature wererat}（狼人）本性。
table.name: 里歇穆洛特的冒险; 里歇穆洛冒险

table.caption: 第二阶段遭遇
rows: 角色避免与任何可能被感染的人直接接触。
有多少人在角色穿过人群时擦身而过？角色必须在难度等级（DC）12的体质豁免检定中成功，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
一个附近的人转过身直接对着角色咳嗽，角色必须成功进行一次DC 14的体质豁免骰，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
一只{@creature rat}（老鼠）在角色的脚上窜过。如果角色没有穿戴金属盔甲，老鼠会抓伤他们，他们必须在难度等级（DC）12的体质豁免检定中成功，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
一个哭泣的孩子在人群中与父母失散。与孩子有身体接触的角色必须成功进行一次DC 14的体质豁免骰，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
一个扒手试图偷窃角色的口袋。如果角色试图通过身体行动阻止罪犯，他们必须成功进行一次DC 12的体质豁免骰，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
table.name: 第二阶段：爆发; 第二阶段遭遇

table.caption: 第三阶段遭遇
rows: 一具尸体躺在角色的路径上。触摸尸体的角色必须成功进行一次DC 12的体质豁免骰，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
一个呕吐的{@creature 普通人}试图抓住角色，恳求任何帮助。任何被这个普通人触摸的人都必须成功进行一次DC 16的体质豁免骰，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
三个沉默头盔队（{@creature animated armor}）示意角色立即进入室内。如果角色抵抗，他们会转为敌对。
几只疥疮的{@creature Giant Rat||巨型老鼠}发起攻击。任何被巨型老鼠咬伤的人必须在难度等级（DC）14的体质豁免检定中成功，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
一个{@creature 老鼠群}在角色旅行时尾随着他们。如果被对峙，老鼠群会发动攻击。任何被老鼠咬伤的人都必须成功进行一次DC 14的体质豁免骰，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
一对年轻且穿着考究的夫妇在公开场合嬉戏，完全不顾隔离措施。这些{@creature Wererat||狼人}除非必要，否则不会显露出他们真正的本性，即使显露也只是为了与老鼠群融为一体。
table.name: 第三阶段：疾病; 第三阶段遭遇

table.caption: 第四阶段遭遇
rows: 一群绝望的{@creature Commoner||平民}试图冲破封闭的大门逃离隔离区。任何试图帮助或阻止他们的人都必须在难度等级（DC）16的体质豁免检定中成功，否则就会感染啃噬瘟疫。
三名小偷攻击一个呼救的人。如果角色介入，所有四名小偷将显露出他们是{@creature 狼人鼠||wererats}并进行攻击。
一队沉默头盔队（{@creature animated armor}）在街上行进。如果沉默头盔队发现了一个角色，他们会试图强迫这个角色进入一个所有居民都已死亡的家中。
角色在一条小巷中发现几只老鼠使用垃圾上演一场微型法庭剧。如果角色打断或批评老鼠的表演，老鼠就会变成一个{@creature 老鼠群}并发动攻击。
角色注意到一只{@creature giant rat}（巨型老鼠）正准备向有人居住的房屋投掷炼金术的火焰。如果他们进行干预，老鼠会逃跑。无论它是否逃脱，角色的住所很快就会成为纵火的目标。
附近的房子里正在举行庆祝活动。六只{@creature Wererat||狼人}公开以混合形态嬉戏，在前房主的尸体旁跳舞和狂欢。
table.name: 第四阶段：瘟疫; 第四阶段遭遇

table.caption: 特佩斯特冒险
rows: 有毒的、能引起幻觉的真菌污染了被毁的布里格达罗村庄。最近，维克塔尔外的定居者在他们的地产上发现了这种真菌，并声称它是由奇怪的覆盖着真菌的两足生物（菌类人）传播的。
曾经居住在卡斯岛废弃堡垒的一个隐士雇佣队伍去取回她遗留在那里的传家宝。但她警告说，阿万克，一个危险的湖中怪物，在附近游荡。
一个牧羊人的最小的孩子在附近的牧场出现一个陷坑后失踪了，这个陷坑揭示了一个发光的洞穴，这个洞穴通向阿拉克的隧道。
帕里什一家因害怕“母亲”而逃离了维克塔尔。他们寻求帮助，以揭露她对他们前邻居的恶意，以免她找到他们。
“母亲的监护人”在维克塔尔的十几个房屋的门上钉上了柳条娃娃。不久之后，这些娃娃和那些房屋的居民都消失了。
一位德鲁伊寻求帮助，以从被称为Blightroot的古老邪恶的{@creature 树灵}手中夺回他们族人的圣地。德鲁伊没有提到周围的森林是这个恶毒植物的克隆群落。
一个悲痛的村民恳求角色们将他们已故的亲人带到大釜，这是一个据说能让浸泡在其水中的尸体恢复生命的水池。村民没有提到水池的魔法所要付出的可怕代价。
两个年轻的恋人从Viktal失踪了。几天后，其中一个被发现，他无法记起任何事情，年龄增长了五十岁，并且迫切需要帮助寻找他们的伴侣。
角色在水面上的倒影警告即将到来的厄运。这个影像坚持要他们找到先知的玻璃，它可以揭示过去和未来。
一个奇怪的老妇人声称她失去了她的孩子，并恳求角色们帮忙。洛琳达这样伪装，希望队伍能找到她逃跑的劳尔塞。
table.name: 特佩斯特的冒险; 特佩斯特冒险

table.caption: Viktal的景象
rows: 当地人将花朵编织成花冠，将肉块缝进斗篷，制作即将到来的节日的传统服装。
镇上的大多数孩子都是混血儿（见《VRGR|1|Hexblood》第1章）。回避的当地人拒绝说明原因。
村民们从笼中收获蛾子的翅膀和蛹，将其磨成粉末，用来制作“变形香料”——一种在当地菜肴中普遍使用的配料。
一群年轻人在一位老妇人的窗前戏剧性地哭泣，她向哭泣声最大的人扔去带角的柳条娃娃。
一位当地渔民教手持小刀的孩子们如何给活鳗鱼去骨，并制作节日性的“鳗鱼冠”——一种阴郁的当地装饰。
在成年人的同意下，小孩子们将角状的棍子固定在一只惊恐动物的头上。
一扇精心雕刻的门或壁画描绘了一张由飞蛾翅膀构成的女性面孔，她注视着一个详细描绘的屠宰或手术场景。
村民们围绕着一个正在经历摘除左眼仪式的人唱歌跳舞，形成一个圆圈。
table.name: 欢迎来到Viktal; Viktal的景象

table.caption: 什一税活动
rows: 歪曲的马上枪术比赛。参与者将高跷绑在他们的手臂和腿上，以使对方失去平衡。
波威里追逐。追逐者装扮成邪恶仙女，身披破烂的红色斗篷，在抓人游戏中使用锋利的飞镖。
失散的兄弟姐妹。蒙眼的参与者通过触摸他们的头发来识别其他玩家。
食丝者。谁吃的活蛾最多，谁就赢。
饥饿的姐妹。十几个腰间系绳的玩家试图阻止某人穿过他们并从碗里偷走一个梨。
永不淘气。参与者轮流恭维三位年长的村民，由他们决定谁是赢家，谁将受到轻拍。
table.name: 什一税活动

table.caption: 洛琳达的女儿
rows: 巨大的直立行走的公羊
由柳条制成的类人生物
几十具缝合在一起的尸体
巨大，尖叫，两足行走的羊
table.name: 母亲的赐福; 洛琳达的女儿

table.caption: 瓦拉坎冒险
rows: 奥塞洛人高兴地接纳一位新成员加入他们的社区，但当查库纳出现并要求所有新来者参加心灵试炼时，仪式突然爆发了冲突。
舒阿兰战士寻求帮助，以杀死一只正在杀害他们人民的巨大{@creature saber-toothed tiger}。他们没有提到，他们最近失去了费尔科维奇的猫，这是一个类似{@item figurine of wondrous power}的有感知魔法物品，可以召唤一只猫科杀手。
一只有智慧的{@creature giant spider}从被称为鞭蛛议会的洞穴中出现。它要求奥塞洛人为它提供祭品，否则瓦拉坎的所有蜘蛛将攻击村庄。
被称为无情母亲的{@creature tyrannosaurus rex}从化石森林中肆虐而出，因为狩猎场中出现了某些问题而愤怒。
环绕安夸拉高原的湖泊中的{@creature lizardfolk}发现了一处沉没的遗迹，并释放了一个现在控制着他们的{@creature aboleth}。
兽形的{@creature Treant||树灵}活化并对潘塔拉旅馆发起围攻，服从乌里克·冯·哈尔科夫的意志。
商船“黄道带”号在基鲁岛搁浅。水手们寻求帮助打捞其他船只残骸，并希望在查库纳注意到他们之前逃回海上。
一群{@creature Displacer Beast||位面兽}在桑吉湾被冲上岸死亡。愤怒的查库纳在丛林中徘徊，杀死她怀疑与此有关的任何人。
table.name: 在瓦拉坎的冒险; 瓦拉坎冒险

table.caption: 瓦拉坎狩猎的复杂情况
rows: 查库纳出现并发动攻击。掷一个骰子。如果你掷出偶数，这将发生在另一个复杂情况中，你可以再次在这个表格上掷骰子。如果你掷出奇数，查库纳会在没有其他复杂情况的情况下突然发动攻击。
茂密的植被、沼泽地、成群的昆虫或浓雾使队伍的行进速度变得极其缓慢。队伍选择一个角色，该角色必须成功进行一次DC 14的智力（{@skill Survival}）检定，否则队伍的行进速度在接下来的一小时内减半（这是在{@quickref difficult terrain||3}的任何速度减少的基础上的额外减少）。
这个区域布满了查库纳设置的陷阱。一个随机的角色必须成功进行一次DC 15智力（{@skill Perception}）检定，否则将掉入一个带刺的坑（参见{@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}）。
{@creature 克拉肯蟹|VRGR|克拉肯蟹}、{@creature 藤蔓枯萎病|VRGR|藤蔓枯萎病}或{@creature 瘟疫传播者僵尸|VRGR|瘟疫传播者僵尸}（见{@book 第5章|VRGR|5}）伏击了队伍。

The characters find a tree bound in rope. One or more withered, oversized hearts hang from cords attached to its branches. Roll a die. If you roll an even number, the hearts look grim but are harmless. If you roll an odd number, the {@dice 1d6} hearts have the statistics of gnashing {@creature Death's Head|VRGR|death's heads} (see {@book chapter 5|VRGR|5}) and attack.
成群的昆虫、顽固的水蛭或其他寄生虫折磨着队伍。每个角色都必须成功进行一次DC 16智力（{@skill Survival}）检定，否则获得1级的{@condition exhaustion}。对疾病免疫的生物不会受到寄生虫的不良影响。

队伍遇到了一位{@creature druid}（德鲁伊）、{@creature green hag}（绿巫婆）或{@creature displacer beast}（位面兽），这些生物不是狩猎的一部分。如果一个角色成功进行一次DC 16魅力（{@skill Persuasion}）检定，那个生物会向他们展示一条路线，允许他们在接下来的一小时内以双倍速度移动，并在那段时间结束时避免再次检定这张表格。
一个个体或一群竞争者——{@creature Gladiator||角斗士}、{@creature Scout||侦察兵}或{@creature Tribal Warrior||部落战士}——试图伏击队伍。
德鲁伊语的低语从树枝和大地的裂缝中传出。它们重复一个词：血。
一个绝望的竞争者出现了。掷一个骰子。如果你掷出偶数，这个竞争者受了重伤，语无伦次，并且遭受幻觉的折磨。如果你掷出奇数，这个竞争者提出帮助队伍破坏试炼的规则，几秒钟后就被森林中的一支箭射死了。
恐龙、{@creature Giant Poisonous Snake||巨型有毒蛇}或{@creature Hydra||多头蛇}攻击队伍。
一条绳桥是跨越河流或峡谷的唯一方法。每个角色必须成功进行一次DC 10的敏捷（{@skill Acrobatics}）检定才能过桥，否则将从60英尺高的地方掉入下方的丛林或水中。绳桥的AC（护甲等级）为11，生命值为16，对毒素和精神伤害免疫。
队伍发现了一个杂草丛生的废墟。如果一个角色成功进行一次DC 18智力（{@skill Perception}）检定，他会看到一个浮雕，上面雕刻着一个邪恶形象的人物正在撕出自己的心脏。
一个随机角色必须成功进行一次DC 14智力（{@skill Perception}）检定，否则将陷入{@book quicksand|DMG|5|流沙}（参见{@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}）。
{@creature Panther||豹子}、{@creature Displacer Beast||位面兽}，或者狼豹（{@creature Weretiger||狼虎}）试图伏击队伍。
角色们发现了一位竞争者的尸体。掷一个骰子。如果你掷出偶数，尸体上有一个{@item potion of healing}（治疗药水）。如果你掷出奇数，尸体的心脏已经被移除。

The party chooses one character who must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check. On a failed check, the party becomes lost. It takes the characters 1 hour to realize they are {@dice 1d4} miles away from their assumed location in a disadvantageous direction.
table.name: 完成试炼; 瓦拉坎狩猎的复杂情况

table.caption: 拉文洛夫领地
rows: {@book 加斯特里亚|VRGR|3|加斯特里亚}
{@book 马尔科维亚|VRGR|3|马尔科维亚}
table.name: 拉文洛夫领地

table.caption: 迷雾中的陌生人
rows: 一个刚被迷雾拉入某个领域来自另一个世界的人
逃离另一个领域黑暗领主的人
一只携带着羽毛守护者信息的乌鸦
由伪装成{@creature wereraven|VRGR}（见《VRGR》第5章）的羽毛守护者的好奇成员
一个在被拉回迷雾之前呼喊的精神，留下了一个迷雾护符
table.name: 迷雾中的旅行者; 迷雾中的陌生人

table.caption: 守护者冒险
rows: 守护者邀请角色参加一个社交聚会，在那里算命，并且与会者尝试稀有的进口木乃伊粉——木乃伊粉末。
一位守护者通过乌鸦给角色们送来了一封信。这条信息没有寄件人。
卡拉克里小矮人神秘学家奥菲·布林德托普对遇见其中一位角色感到惊讶，因为他很久以前在降神会上收到了一条给他们的信息。
角色们被邀请帮助一位守护者监视墓地，希望能找到据说居住在那里的传说中的生物。
该团队被雇佣从巴洛维亚城镇瓦拉基的蓝水客栈收集一个包裹，该客栈实际上是由变形乌鸦秘密运营的。他们不得打开包裹，并且必须迅速将其带出巴洛维亚。
一个角色瞥见了一个类似乌鸦的身影。当他们调查时，他们只找到了它留下的神秘护符。
table.name: 守护者冒险

table.caption: 按挑战等级排列的生物
table.name: 怪物图鉴; 按挑战等级排列的生物

table.caption: Feywild Weather
rows: Flower blossoms rain from a sky filled with sparkling, pastel-colored clouds.
A grand fairy drama plays in the sky as a stylistically rendered illusion or a swirling aurora.
It rains tiny fruit tarts. They fall slowly and disappear just before they hit the ground. If caught from the air and eaten, they're delicious.
Fog rolls in and plays harmless tricks on the characters, giving them fog mustaches, fog eyebrows, and fog wigs of many styles—perhaps even fog cloaks or fog companions.
Snow begins to fall, and the flakes grow bigger over time. Flakes as big as dinner plates, wagon wheels, and even a waterwheel fall, but they're light as a feather.
The sky fills with iridescent bubbles that lazily fall to the ground. Giggling pixie children chase and pop the bubbles but turn {@condition invisible} and flee if spoken to or approached.
A silvery rain lifts the spirits and brings a song to each heart that it touches.

A howling wind blows through the party, and each party member must roll a {@dice d8}. Anyone who rolls an 8 has a trinket or some other tiny, nonmagical item (such as a coin) stolen from them by weather spirits.
table.name: Feywild Weather

table.caption: Feywild Guide Identities
rows: Friendly forest gnome (use the {@creature scout} stat block, but change its size to Small)
Gloomy wood elf druid (use the {@creature druid} stat block)
Overly cautious {@creature treant sapling|wbtw} (see chapter 1 of The Wild Beyond the Witchlight for its stat block)
Giggly goblin warlock (use the {@creature cult fanatic} stat block, but change its size to Small)
table.name: Feywild Guides; Feywild Guide Identities

table.caption: Feywild Guide Quirks
rows: Always hearkens back and compares things to "the good old days"
Can't tell a lie without wiggling their nose first
Loves food and isn't picky about what they eat
On a secret quest that they can't talk about, except to remind others that they're "on a secret quest"
Afraid of something commonplace, such as heights, enclosed spaces, or bare hands and feet
Carries around a suitcase full of wigs, forks, ashes, glass orbs, left shoes, or something else strange
Full of folksy wisdom that usually starts with, "Papa always said..." or "Mama always said..."
table.name: Feywild Guides; Feywild Guide Quirks

table.caption: Fey Desires for Greater Contracts
rows: To take the next child born in your family and raise the child in the Feywild
The completion of three quests, each of which you must agree to before the contract is formed
The ruin or demise of the Fey's sworn enemy
A precious object (such as a rare, very rare, or legendary magic item) that was stolen by or belongs to the Fey's sworn enemy
An art object that is deemed priceless, such as a famous painting that hangs in a museum
Your youth (which the Fey can harvest and bestow on another creature)
table.name: Price of a Contract; Fey Desires for Greater Contracts

table.caption: Fey Desires for Lesser Contracts
rows: A trinket that carries great sentimental value
Companionship (you remain in the Fey's company for an agreed-upon period of time)
The memory of your first kiss
The spring in your step or the sparkle in your eyes
Your name (requiring you to choose a new one for yourself)
table.name: Price of a Contract; Fey Desires for Lesser Contracts

table.caption: Breaking a Greater Contract
rows: You can't speak or cast spells with verbal components. Whenever you try to speak, you bray like a donkey instead.

You magically transform into an owl. You retain your languages, your ability to speak, and your mental ability scores (Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma). You otherwise have the statistics of an owl.
You can't attune to magic items. If you are currently attuned to one or more magic items, your attunement to those items ends immediately.
An iron thorn is magically lodged in your chest. Every day, you can feel it move closer to your heart. If this effect is not ended within 3 days, you die and can't be revived for {@dice 5d12} days.
table.name: Breaking a Contract; Breaking a Greater Contract

table.caption: Breaking a Lesser Contract
rows: Your appearance becomes more toad-like (warty skin, bulbous eyes, large mouth, and webbed digits). This transformation has no game effects.
You smell like swamp gas. No amount of bathing can rid you of this stench.
Your shadow does not match your movements, which other creatures find unsettling.
Your appearance becomes more rat-like (beady eyes, whiskers, small ears, pointy nose, little hands and feet, and a rat's tail). This transformation has no game effects.
You cast no reflection. Superstitious folk who notice think you're a vampire.
You are constantly surrounded by a small cloud of annoying but harmless flies.
table.name: Breaking a Contract; Breaking a Lesser Contract

table.caption: Fey Curses
rows: Your ears are magically replaced by a pair of soft, fuzzy donkey ears. Moreover, when you try to speak, you instead bray.
You gain {@dice 1d3} levels of {@condition exhaustion}. Until the curse ends, these levels of {@condition exhaustion} can't be removed.
Spells can't restore hit points to you.
The sound of pixie laughter fills your head while you are awake, drowning out all other sounds.
Anything you try to pick up or hold in your hands slips through your fingers.
Moonlight burns your flesh. You take {@damage 1d10} radiant damage when you start your turn in moonlight.

You are magically transformed into an animated wooden doll that looks like you. Your statistics are the same, but you are a Construct with vulnerability to fire damage, and you don't require air, food, or drink. Items worn or carried by you are unaffected.
Whenever you tell a lie, you lose the ability to speak for {@dice 1d8} hours.
table.name: Fey Curses

table.caption: Ending the Curse
rows: You must carve your name into a tree, whereupon the tree inherits the curse's magic and dies.
You must drink the blood of a pixie or sprite while basking in moonlight.
You must speak the true name of the creature that cursed you three times in a row.
While standing in sunlight on an arched bridge over running water, you must beg the Summer Queen for her "fair blessing."
After filling your pockets with fool's gold, you must flap your arms and quack like a duck.
You must bury an executioner's hood (a blackcapped mushroom found in the Feywild) in the earth and pour goat's milk over it while whistling.
You must be bitten by a faerie dragon. (It's possible any faerie dragon might do, or the faerie dragon might have to be of a particular color.)
You must leave a bouquet of eight black roses at the place where you were cursed, or you must give the bouquet to the creature that cursed you.
You must persuade a centaur to carry you on its back for eight miles. Before the centaur will do this willingly, it might demand a gift or service in exchange, or the completion of a quest.
You must obtain leaves or pinecones from three different species of treants and burn them in a campfire under a full moon while singing a particular campfire song.
You must bake a small cake and leave it on the doorstep of a forest gnome's abode. Only when the gnome eats the whole cake does your curse end.
You must persuade another creature to willingly take your name. If it does so, it inherits your curse, whereupon you are nameless and must choose a new name for yourself.
table.name: Fey Curses; Ending the Curse

table.caption: Fey Abodes
rows: A pagoda overgrown with flowering vines that beckon visitors with pleasing scents
A crooked stone tower that has a moon-like orb of light circling its rooftop, which causes the tower's shadow to move like a clock hand
A decrepit mansion that is partially sunk in the middle of a bog
A rocky hill shaped like a sleeping satyr, with its open mouth forming a cave entrance
A windmill that walks around on giant crow's feet
A crumbling keep on a small island in the middle of a mist-shrouded loch
An old farm overgrown with giant pumpkins
A treehouse built in the boughs of a treant
A tower that used to be the trunk of a giant {@condition petrified} tree, with rope bridges connecting it to the giant living trees that surround it
One or more houses in hollowed-out mushrooms
A gingerbread cottage with a frosting-covered roof, frosting icicles, chocolate doors, and gumdrop gardens
A musty, web-shrouded stone cottage surrounded by an orchard of awakened apple trees
A walking stone colossus with a tower for a head
A cave-riddled hill that walks around on giant stone feet
A walled garden filled with friendly critters, talking flowers, and grasping vines
A well-preserved elven tomb overgrown with moss, decorated with statues, and festooned with bird nests
An inn or hostel carved into the foot of a hill
A dragon skull lying in the sand
One or more giant rusty helmets that serve as houses, surrounded by an ancient battlefield
table.name: Fey Abodes

table.caption: Archfey's Presentation
rows: {@b Adorable.} The archfey has taken on the form of something adorable, such as an otter, a fawn, a sugar glider, a wombat, or a beautiful butterfly.
{@b Ancient.} This archfey appears to be eons old. They might have gnarled skin like teakwood and long, gray hair that looks like elaborate lacework.
{@b Bizarre.} This archfey looks like something from the realm of dreams. They could take on the appearance of a scintillating ball of light, a floating mask, or a whispering shadow.
{@b Floral.} Flowers bloom from the archfey's fingertips, and their skin is covered in petals. Their body might have thorns, or they could have vine-like hair covered in sweet-smelling blossoms.
{@b Fluid.} The archfey can change body type or transform from one creature into another.
{@b Iridescent.} The archfey floats off the ground and gazes about with glowing eyes, their body surrounded by a nimbus of light and their skin sparkling like sunlight on water.

{@b Metallic.} The archfey appears to be made of metal. Their face is an exquisitely crafted mask of mithral, silver, or gold, and their body is made of finely tooled metal etched with organic designs or cryptic symbols.

{@b Monstrous.} This archfey has a monstrous form. For example, they might resemble an enormous spider, a hydra whose heads look like oversized elf heads with fangs, or any other horrific form you can imagine.
table.name: Archfey's Presentation

table.caption: Archfey's Personality
rows: {@b Benevolent.} The archfey welcomes all into their domain and does everything in their power to assist those who come to them in true friendship or grave need.
{@b Covetous.} The archfey hoards things they consider valuable and uses spies to find more of what they covet. The archfey never leaves their lair for fear that their hoard might be plundered.
{@b Imperious.} The archfey surrounds themself with a court of sycophants and expects visitors to grovel before them. Their mercy is rare, and their superiority complex is legendary.
{@b Madcap.} The archfey loves to sing, dance, drink, wear silly masks, do cartwheels, and throw parties where everyone is free to cavort and revel how they wish.

{@b Mercurial.} The archfey has two personalities (choose two other personalities from this table). They shift back and forth between these personalities at certain times or when certain conditions are met.

{@b Mischievous.} The archfey is a trickster who likes to confound and frustrate visitors to their domain and who surrounds themself with sly creatures such as boggles, pixies, foxes, magpies, and crows.

{@b Reclusive.} The archfey prefers to be left alone and seldom, if ever, leaves their domain. They might adopt disguises or turn {@condition invisible} when they travel, and they might use magic to conceal their lair.
{@b Wild.} The archfey has the demeanor of a wild animal and shuns the trappings of society.
table.name: Archfey's Personality

table.caption: Archfey Obsession
rows: {@b Beauty.} The archfey does everything in their power to rid their domain of that which they consider ugly. What they consider beautiful is not always clear, however.

{@b Color.} This archfey is obsessed with a particular color and puts their subjects to work making sure the archfey's favorite color is predominant. Wearing another color in the domain could be seen as laughable, obnoxious, or downright rude.

{@b Etiquette.} The rules in the archfey's domain change as they learn about some new custom that is popular in the Summer Court. The archfey requires all creatures in their domain to respect the new rules of etiquette.
{@b Magic.} Magic in all its forms fascinates the archfey. They collect magic items and spellbooks, and they enjoy seeing demonstrations of magic from visitors.
Material {@b Plane.} The archfey is obsessed with creatures and objects from the Material Plane. There is a scent, an energy, and a uniqueness to them that fascinates the archfey.
{@b Monsters.} The archfey has a menagerie of monsters and is obsessed with finding marvelous new creatures to add to its collection.

Rule of {@b Three.} The archfey is obsessed with the Rule of Three. They look for patterns, deeper meanings, and ill omens in things that occur in threes. The archfey's obsession is reflected throughout their domain, where things seem to naturally come in threes.

{@b Stories.} The archfey wants nothing more than to listen to stories told by creatures from faraway places. They love to gather lore so they can build their own internal world of imagination or transform their domain with ideas from other worlds. Their lair is festooned with books, which give the archfey inspiration.
table.name: Obsessions; Archfey Obsession

table.caption: Signature Magic
rows: {@b Arcane Antlers.} The archfey has antlers made of metal, crystal, bone, or some other substance, which allow the archfey to raise the dead. They shed their antlers and grow new ones every hundred years, prompting thieves to sneak into the domain to acquire the shed antlers.
{@b Compelling Voice.} The archfey has a magical voice that can charm creatures of a certain type (such as Beasts or Fey). This voice might be as soft as a whisper or loud like thunder.
{@b Dreamwalk.} When they sleep, the archfey projects a ghost-like version of themself that can leave their body and go anywhere in their domain.
{@b Hand of Knowing.} One of the archfey's hands blurs as though it were in multiple places at once. The archfey can learn the entire history of a creature or object by touching it with that hand.
{@b Health Aura.} The archfey's presence rids creatures and vegetation of disease. Healthy vegetation yields an overabundance of flowers and fruit.

{@b Scrying Eye.} This archfey has an ornately crafted, removable eye that has the power of {@sense truesight} (as described in the Monster Manual). The archfey can see through this orb at all times. If the detached eye is destroyed, it rematerializes undamaged in the archfey's empty eye socket.
{@b Simulacra.} The archfey can make magical copies of themself and other creatures. These simulacra are similar to those created by the {@spell simulacrum} spell.
{@b Time Distortion.} For each minute spent in the archfey's presence, an hour passes elsewhere.
table.name: Signature Magic

table.caption: Magical Gifts
rows: {@b Charm.} The archfey bestows a charm of the DM's choice (see "Supernatural Gifts" in the Dungeon Master's Guide).

{@b Guide.} The archfey summons a magical guide that takes the form of a faerie dragon, a sprite, or some other creature. The guide is a harmless figment that can't be damaged, and it knows its way around the Feywild. It can't leave the Feywild and disappears after eight days.
{@b Lore.} With a touch, the archfey magically imparts useful knowledge about a particular subject of the archfey's choice. This knowledge might be permanent, or it might fade over time.
Magic {@b Item.} The archfey bestows a useful magic item (such as a crystal ball or an oathbow) but warns that the item will vanish after a specified period of time, which it does.

{@b Refuge.} The archfey creates a wooded glen, a dome of brambles, a silken cocoon, or some other kind of refuge. Creatures hostile toward the gift's recipient can't enter this refuge without the recipient's consent. After a specified period of time, the refuge vanishes.
{@b Resurrection.} The archfey offers one free casting of the {@spell true resurrection} spell, which they can cast as an action without material components once per century.
{@b Training.} With a touch, the archfey grants the benefit of months of special training (see "Marks of Prestige" in the Dungeon Master's Guide for different benefits of training).
{@b Transformation.} The archfey offers one free casting of the {@spell true polymorph} spell, which they can cast without material components. The spell's effect can be made permanent, if you wish.
table.name: Magical Gifts

table.caption: Geographical Features
rows: A colossal, gnarled tree, its trunk riddled with passageways, halls, chambers, and staircases
A valley filled with grassy meadows and groves of trees along a running river, nestled between two snow-capped mountains that look like the points of a crescent moon
A crystal castle that sings in sunlight or moonlight
A vast thicket of thick roots, thorny vines, and sinuous creepers that weave together to form long tunnels, grand hallways, and enormous domes
A complex of caves connected by passageways formed by Fey magic to create grand galleries and soaring vaults
Rolling farmland that yields healthy, bountiful produce of amazing size
A forest of tower-sized mushrooms, or a forest of tiny mushrooms that characters must shrink down to explore
An island that is actually a colossal sleeping turtle
table.name: Geographical Features

table.caption: Domain Theme
rows: {@b Adversarial.} Adversarial personalities are common here, even among the local wildlife. Animated trees swat at passersby, sentient flowers scoff and sneer, and local Fey are grumpy and uncooperative.
{@b Crystalline.} This domain contains a profusion of crystal formations and outgrowths, as well as structures and trees made of crystal. Some of the crystals might generate light, music, or both.
{@b Gloomy.} Everything here has a gloomy cast. Tree branches look like skeletal fingers, night creatures slink and flutter about, and skull-like faces appear on plants, stones, and sprites' wings.

{@b Inquisitive.} Creatures in this domain are nosy and hungry for gossip. Animated trees use their branches to pick through backpacks when travelers aren't looking; pixies spy on strangers; and birds eavesdrop on conversations, repeating what they've heard to their masters.

{@b Kaleidoscopic.} This domain is a riot of everchanging colors. Plants come in a dazzling array of colors, flowers change color to suit the prevailing mood, and Fey wear costumes of scintillating hues.
{@b Lackadaisical.} The creatures here are easygoing. No one is in a hurry, and no task is greeted with a sense of urgency.

{@b Musical.} This domain abounds with music. Frogs, toads, and insects break into multipart harmonies that sometimes crescendo into a symphonic rapture of melodious tweets, trills, chirps, and whistles. Fey in this domain are just as musically inclined.

{@b Poisonous.} Almost every plant here has spines or thorns that cause anything from itchy welts to damage or out-of-body experiences. Other sources of poison might be present as well (for example, toxic bogs or giant, poisonous Beasts).
table.name: Domain Theme

table.caption: Fey Crossings
rows: {@b Altar.} This stone altar might be found atop a lonely plateau, behind a waterfall, inside a cave, or in some other remote location. When certain stars align and the proper ritual is performed, the fey crossing appears as a portal above the altar.

{@b Crystal Cave.} This cave is filled with natural crystalline formations and resembles a glittering cathedral. When moonlight shines into the cave at night, it causes a shimmering pool or spring in the center of the cave to transform into a fey crossing.
{@b Hollow Tree.} The fey crossing lies within the hollow interior of an enormous tree. The crossing is open to anyone who carries a leaf or acorn from the tree.

{@b Maze.} The fey crossing lies at the center of a maze that might change configuration from time to time. To use the crossing, one must walk or run from the maze's entrance to its center. Creatures who circumvent the maze using magic or flight find themselves unable to use the crossing.

{@b Mushroom Circle.} This fey crossing appears as a circle of mushrooms. The size of the mushrooms and the width of the circle can vary, but activating the fey crossing requires that a particular act be performed inside it or a particular object or creature be present.

{@b Ruined Tower.} The ruins of an ancient elven tower house a fey crossing. For three nights each year, a ghostly image of the intact tower appears above the ruined foundation, during which time the fey crossing appears as a shimmering doorway that creatures can pass through.

{@b Stone Bridge.} A Fey creature hides under this ancient stone bridge. In exchange for treasure or some other gift, this Fey can use its innate magic to create a portal atop the bridge that serves as a fey crossing.
{@b Stone Circle.} This circle of stone megaliths contains a fey crossing that is active during equinoxes and solstices.
table.name: Coming and Going; Fey Crossings

table.caption: Shortcut Routines
rows: Picking petals from a flower while walking toward a beckoning sunset
Playing "Ode to the Summer Queen" on a {@item lute|PHB} while skipping counterclockwise around a tree
Eating a mushroom while gazing at one's own reflection in a clear pool or stream of water
Doing a headstand in a ring of stones
Staring at firelight while playing a {@item flute|PHB} or singing about a fond memory
Sitting by a creek while lost in childlike wonder
Whistling a tune while walking backward
Holding hands and dancing around a tree at twilight
table.name: Magical Shortcuts; Shortcut Routines

table.caption: Domain Drama
rows: A cherished object or favorite pet belonging to the domain's archfey ruler has gone missing.
Fomorians (or other hostile creatures) have emerged from a cave and are causing a ruckus.
The domain's archfey ruler recently turned down an invitation to the Gloaming Court, offending the Queen of Air and Darkness, whose spies are now sowing discord throughout the domain.
The domain's archfey has fallen into a magical slumber. Others are looking for someone they can trust to find a way to awaken the archfey.
The vegetation is sick in part of the domain, and the contagion is spreading. The domain's archfey needs help finding the cause of the sickness.
Part of the domain overlaps the domain of another archfey, and the Fey living in that region are tired of answering to two masters. They won't be happy until one archfey yields to the other.
A sleeping knight in silver plate mail bearing no distinguishing symbols has been discovered in a hollow tree trunk. Local Fey wonder who she is and if they should revive her or not.

An arranged wedding was supposed to unite two feuding villages, but one of the grooms has disappeared. Everyone is searching for him in the hope that the wedding will take place, bringing peace to the domain.
table.name: Domain Drama

table.caption: Weird Magic Effects
rows: Time visibly moves more quickly outside the region than inside it. For every minute the party spends inside the region, one hour passes outside the region.

Flowers not only are abundant in the region but also have faces and limited sentience, allowing them to communicate with creatures in the Elvish and Sylvan tongues. They know what has transpired in the region within the past day and happilyshare this information.
Each character in the region gains the benefit of a {@spell barkskin} spell that lasts for 8 hours.

Each character who spends 1 hour in the region undergoes a magical transformation, gaining fur, a tail, and large ears reminiscent of a donkey's, goat's, or llama's. This effect ends on a character {@dice 3d8} hours after the character leaves the region. Any magic that ends a curse also restores the character's normal appearance.

Harmless fireflies gather and flit around one character in the region, sharing that character's space for 1 hour. The fireflies generate bright light out to a range of 10 feet and dim light for an additional 10 feet. While surrounded by the fireflies, the character feels a profound sense of purpose and gains the benefit of the {@spell bless} spell.

Creatures in the region can't leave it and find themselves covering the same ground over and over. By the time they realize this, {@dice 3d8} hours have passed, during which they have made no progress in their effort to leave. The effect then ends.

One character in the region sees a wide, grinning mouth that floats in midair, 10 feet away from them. No other creature can see the grinning mouth. In a language the character understands, the mouth says, "I'll answer three questions you put to me. Noes and yesses, I promise thee." The character can ask it three questions as if using the {@spell commune} spell.

One character in the region triggers a wild magic effect that is determined by rolling on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table in the "Sorcerer" section of the Player's Handbook. If the effect duplicates a spell, the character's spellcasting ability for that spell is Charisma.
table.name: Weird Magic Effects

table.caption: Random Group Patron
rows: An unlikely pair who want to bankroll you to become famous adventurers. Why not have some laughs on your way to stardom.
Work for the most prestigious academy in the world. Seek out ancient secrets and rare artifacts and place them in the care of the monks of Candlekeep.
Join in the epic struggle between good and evil and help ensure that war doesn't engulf the world.
Become an explorer who travels to the edges of the world.
Work for the world's most feared mercenaries.
Join the Harpers, a famed organization that works from the shadows to keep the world from falling into ruin.
Lost in the Feywild for more than a millennium, Suldil wants you to help her resurrect the ancient Knights of Bahamut.
Rulers and prisoners of a haunted elven city consumed by the Shadowfell. You must help them escape.
Grizzled veterans recruit you to aid the enigmatic Raven Queen in her quest to collect memories.
{@creature Imoen|MaBJoV}, {@creature Montaron and the Laughing Skull|MaBJoV|Montaron}
The oldest and most dangerous thief's guild in Faerûn, the Shadow Thieves have long ago grown beyond simple thievery.

table.caption: Random Campaign Villain
rows: The lord of lies. He spins a web of intrigue and untruths that threatens to make a mockery of all that is good and decent.
The god of murder. Thought dead for more than a century. Recently reborn, he seeks to wash the world in blood in order to rebuild his power.
A prince of elemental evil. Ruler of the plane of ice. He wants to bring a winter to the world that never ends.
The archdevil of Hellfire. Second only to Asmodeus in power and deviousness. Why corrupt a single soul when you can corrupt the soul of an entire world.
{@creature Aribeth de Tylmarande|mabjov}, A Group Patron
The first and most ancient demon lord. He has been trapped in an {@item iron flask} and must be kept imprisoned until a way is found to destroy him.
The first Slaad. Lord of chaos and insanity. She wants to spread her anarchy and filth across the entire world.
{@creature Xzar the Chaos Clone|mabjov|Xzar, Death Slaad}

table.caption: Origin of Dragon Eggs
rows: {@b Spontaneous Reincarnation}. When an adult or older dragon dies, one or more eggs form in the dragon's decomposing body. These eggs might grow like fungus as the body rots away, they could appear among the ashes after the body is consumed by fire, or they might need to be mined out from a corpse that has turned to solid stone or metal.

{@b Seedlings of the First World}. At the heart of the world (underground, or in a remote area of pristine wilderness) stands a tree on which dragon eggs grow like fruit. Once in a lifetime, each dragon feels an overwhelming urge to seek out this tree. After finding it, the dragon must persuade its guardian to relinquish one or more eggs.
{@b Consuming Treasure}. By eating a significant portion of their own hoards, dragons cause themselves to lay clutches of eggs.
{@b Magical Crafting}. Mirroring the creative acts of Bahamut and Tiamat, dragons craft their eggs through painstaking labor, then breathe the gift of life into them.

{@b Draconic Transformation}. Enlightened non-dragons (most often Humanoids) are transformed into dragon eggs when they die, when they experience profound enlightenment, or when they undergo a ritual that might involve bathing in dragon blood or being devoured by a dragon. Humanoids and dragons alike understand the transformation to be a transition into a higher state of existence.
{@b Divine Origin}. Only Bahamut and Tiamat can create dragon eggs—each egg is the result of divine intervention.

{@b Spontaneous Formation}. Dragon eggs arise naturally in certain regions, often in underground veins of metal ore or gems for metallic and gem dragons, respectively, or in extreme environments (volcanoes, arctic wastes, deadly swamps, and so forth) for chromatic dragons. The eggs might hatch on their own, or they might have to be unearthed first by another creature, whether that's an adult or older dragon or a hapless miner.
{@b Parthenogenesis}. An adult or older dragon can lay a clutch of eggs whenever the dragon feels ready to rear a clutch of wyrmlings—or to impose that responsibility on others.

{@b Dragon Conclave}. Five adult or older dragons of different kinds come together to create a clutch of eggs, with each giving up a bit of life energy as part of the process. This clutch of eggs hatches five dragons of different kinds, depending on the dragons making up the conclave.
{@b Rejuvenation}. An ancient dragon voluntarily enters a deep trance and eventually dies, leaving behind a single egg.
table.name: Reproduction; Origin of Dragon Eggs

table.caption: Half-Dragon Origin
rows: {@b Regional Effects}. The magical influence of a dragon's lair causes half-dragons to spontaneously arise among the area's other creatures.
{@b Forbidden Fruit}. A dragon can cause a particular tree to produce magical fruit. When eaten by a creature able to bear children, the fruit causes the creature to bear a half-dragon.

{@b True Love's Gift}. Love occasionally blossoms between dragons and creatures of other kinds, and this life bond can result in half-dragon children. Most half-dragons born of love are created as a magical gift.

{@b Blood Transformation}. A creature that bathes in or drinks the blood of a dragon can sometimes be transformed into a half-dragon. A dragon might voluntarily offer some blood to bring this about, or it could happen accidentally when a would-be dragonslayer is splashed with dragon blood.
{@b Cradle Favor}. A dragon might bestow the gift of draconic power on a newborn baby or an unborn child—as either a blessing or a curse.
{@b Hoard Thieves}. The hoard of an older dragon is imbued with that dragon's power. Those who steal from such a hoard might transform into half-dragons as that power leaches into them.
table.name: Half-Dragons; Half-Dragon Origin

table.caption: Dragon Death Throes
rows: The dragon immediately uses one of its lair actions, centering the effect on itself. For example, a fallen black dragon and any characters around it might be pulled into a nearby pool of water, and a copper dragon's body might be swallowed suddenly in mud.
The dragon uses its breath weapon one last time.
The dragon's body transforms into stone, metal, lava, ice, or mist. Or the body dissipates, leaving behind only a transformed heart or other organ.
Roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table in the "{@class Sorcerer|phb}" section of the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, rerolling any inappropriate result.
A surge of life energy erupts from the dragon, causing each creature within 120 feet of the body to gain the benefit of finishing a long rest.
The body is drawn through a portal to the lair of one of the dragon's echoes on another world, increasing that echo's power.
table.name: Death of a Dragon; Dragon Death Throes

table.caption: Undead Dragon Adventure Hooks
rows: A dragon seeks help, desperate to prevent a dracolich-worshiping cult from convincing the dragon's sibling, mate, or rival to become a dracolich.
A dragon suffering from a wasting affliction asks the characters to travel to another world, where they must destroy an echo of that dragon who has become a dracolich.
A pirate crew under the command of a {@creature ghost dragon|FTD} fights to recover the dead dragon's scattered hoard.

A {@creature hollow dragon|FTD} guards an artifact meant to be used in the dire circumstances foretold in an ancient prophecy. Now the prophecy is coming to pass, but the dragon won't let the artifact be used for its intended purpose.
A gem dragon from another world is searching for the dragon's echo, which has become a {@creature draconic shard|FTD}.

A dracolich keeps returning after being destroyed. The dracolich's connection to its echoes on other worlds is keeping its soul intact, like a phylactery, and the connection must be severed before the creature's threat can be ended.
table.name: Undeath; Undead Dragon Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Dragon Echo Characteristics
rows: Same dragon kind and age, differing only in physical appearance
Same dragon kind and age, differing only in a peculiar mannerism
Same dragon kind and age, but significantly different in personality, ideals, or alignment
Same dragon kind and generally alike, but older or younger by one category
Same age, different kind within the same family (chromatic, gem, or metallic), and similar in appearance and personality
Same age, different kind in a different family (with a similar breath weapon or habitat), with similar appearance but very different ideals or alignment
Radically different in almost every way imaginable but still bound by fate across the worlds
Roll again, and in addition the echo is Undead (a dracolich, {@creature hollow dragon|FTD}, {@creature ghost dragon|FTD}, or {@creature draconic shard|FTD}) or a shadow dragon.
table.name: Echoes across the Worlds; Dragon Echo Characteristics

table.caption: Cult of the Dragon Adventure Hooks
rows: A group of cultists has stolen a dragon egg, with the dual goal of hatching a minion for themselves and gaining leverage over the dragon who was caring for the egg. But the dragon wants the egg back.
A group of cultists is trying to access a magic portal linking the Material Plane to Tiamat's domain, hoping to break the seal that has kept the portal closed for centuries.

A dragon whose echo on another world has become a dracolich suffers from a wasting affliction (see "{@book Undeath|FTD|3|Undeath}" above). Members of the Cult of the Dragon are trying to persuade the afflicted dragon to become a dracolich as well.

A dragon and a dracolich, representing the opposing factions of the Cult of the Dragon, war against each other. Their battle is devastating the region between their lairs and endangers countless innocents.
A group of cultists searches for all the {@item Orb of Dragonkind||Orbs of Dragonkind}, planning to use them to bend dragons to their will.
A fringe group of cultists decides to focus on the "shattered thrones" part of the ancient prophecy and attempts to assassinate rulers and destroy their seats of power.
table.name: Cult of the Dragon Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Chamber Adventure Hooks
rows: An agent of the Chamber has plundered the research of an eccentric sage whose work is widely considered nonsense, suggesting that something important is hidden in the sage's notes.
A dragon of the Chamber is convinced that dragonmarked Humanoids on Eberron have echoes on other worlds of the Material Plane, and seeks ways to identify them.
A dragon of the Chamber draws the characters from one Material Plane world to another, trying to glean information about the Prophecy by examining the relationship between the two worlds.
A member of the Chamber seeks to hire the characters to explore a dungeon that was recently discovered behind a sigil-inscribed stone seal.

A member of the Chamber believes that one of the characters could serve as "the Child of Winter" (or some similar title) mentioned in the Prophecy and tries to manipulate the character into bringing the terms of the Prophecy to pass.
A Fiend tries to trick the characters into slaying a dragon belonging to the Chamber.
table.name: Chamber Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Lauth Goals
rows: Support the establishment of a powerful empire to maintain order in the lauth's territory
Bring about the downfall of a powerful empire
End the influence of Aberrations originating in the Underdark
Seek out and destroy hundreds of cursed magic items created by an ancient lich
Destroy an archdevil, a demon prince, a powerful Celestial, or an archfey whose extraplanar influence is altering the lauth's territory
Bring about (or prevent) the fulfillment of a prophecy uttered by an ancient dragon centuries ago
table.name: Common Purpose; Lauth Goals

table.caption: Hidecarved Wards
rows: {@b Immutability}. The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

{@b Inscrutability}. The dragon is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to ascertain its intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.
{@b Magic Resistance}. The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
{@b Damage Resistance}. The dragon has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

{@b Additional Resistance}. The dragon has resistance to one type of damage. Roll a {@dice d8}, rerolling if you get a damage type the dragon is already resistant or immune to: 1, acid; 2, cold; 3, fire; 4, lightning; 5, necrotic: 6, psychic; 7, radiant; 8, thunder.
{@b Death Ward}. The dragon can cast the {@spell death ward} spell on itself and regains the ability to do so after a long rest.
table.name: Engraved Wards; Hidecarved Wards

table.caption: Hidecarved Dragons Adventure Hooks
rows: A hidecarved dragon hires the characters to undertake a quest in pursuit of the lauth's goal.
A lauth becomes convinced that their goal demands the destruction of the characters.
A lauth unexpectedly aids the characters' quest, which aligns with the hidecarved dragons' goal.
A lauth opposes the characters' quest, which is at odds with the hidecarved dragons' goal.
Following reports of a dangerous dragon in the region, the characters discover the dragon is part of a lauth whose goal is worth aiding.

A dragon asks the characters to help figure out why mysterious arcane markings have suddenly appeared on the dragon's scales. Solving this puzzle might mean journeying to another world or finding a way to help awaken the dragon's dragonsight.
table.name: Hidecarved Dragons Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Inheritors of the First World Adventure Hooks
rows: A fleeing foe disappears into a magic portal linked to another world of the Material Plane. When the characters follow this enemy, they draw the attention of dragons who want to know more about the world they came from.
The lair of a gem dragon turns out to be a magical nexus containing portals linked to the lairs of the dragon's echoes on several other worlds.

The characters discover an enormous ruby deep in the Underdark. When word of their find gets out, the gem becomes the target of thieves and eventually of dragons who believe it is the heart of Sardior and a key to the Ruby Dragon's return.

A dragon offers to pay the characters handsomely if they travel to another world. There, they must make contact with the dragon's echo and solve the mystery of why their patron has been unable to learn dragonsight.

Priests or dragon servitors of Bahamut send the characters to combat the Inheritors of the First World, worried that any attempt to restore Bahamut and Tiamat's primal creation will anger the gods and rekindle the ancient wars between dragons and Humanoids.

Dragons establish a permanent portal connecting two worlds of the Material Plane, establishing an exciting era of discovery and trade between them. But the longer the portal remains open, the larger it grows, seemingly drawing the two worlds together into a catastrophic collision.
table.name: Inheritors of the First World Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Relationships and Adventures
rows: The dragon is trying to eliminate a business rival through ruthless competition or underhanded means, and the rival seeks the characters' help. (Business owner)
A struggling merchant hires the characters to identify a mysterious competitor who seems to have unlimited resources. (Business owner)
A repentant enemy comes to the characters, telling them that a former companion of the enemy is actually a manipulative dragon—and asking them to help get revenge. (Companion)
The characters develop an ever-closer friendship with a secretive person who seems to have inexhaustible wealth and an endless supply of useful information. (Companion)
A city council asks the characters to help put an end to a deadly war between two criminal gangs, not knowing one of the gangs is led by a dragon. (Crime boss)
While the characters fight a crime family in a major city, they discover their patron is a dragon hoping to take over the criminal enterprise. (Crime boss)

A small nation is worried about the aggressive expansion of a dragon-ruled empire on the opposite side of a desert, ocean, or mountain range. Its leaders seek aid from powerful adventurers who can protect the nation from conquest. (Emperor)
As the characters become powerful enough that they might conceivably threaten a dragon ruler, they are given a choice: enter government service or face exile in the wild borderlands. (Emperor)
Two nobles worry about the amount of money their heir is donating to a new temple. (God)
A dragon with developed dragonsight is trying to bring together worshipers from multiple worlds to perform a ritual that will let the dragon ascend to true godhood. (God)
A dragon noble's servants have kidnapped a well-known storyteller or musician because the dragon is having trouble sleeping. (Noble)
An aristocrat is being blackmailed by someone threatening to reveal that the noble is actually a dragon in disguise. (Noble)
When the characters defeat a powerful enemy, the enemy's "pet" dragon tries to adopt the characters. (Parental figure)
When the characters kill a dragon's minions, the distraught dragon surrenders and agrees to leave the area—while secretly plotting revenge against the party. (Parental figure)
Another group of adventurers—supplied with superior equipment and information by their dragon patron—is pursuing the same goal as the characters. (Patron)
Local aristocrats complain that the best artists and performers are being lured away by a mysterious patron's promises of riches. (Patron)
A dragon can teach great magical secrets. But any would-be disciples must prove their worth by acquiring a valuable item to add to the dragon's hoard. (Teacher)
A dragon teacher from a character's past (whom the character might not know is a dragon) asks for help tracking down a student who has turned to evil. (Teacher)
A marauding group of bandits has grown from an irritation to a significant threat after coming under the leadership of a dragon. (Warlord)
The warlike minions of two dragons are clashing in skirmishes across the region, devastating peaceful villages and farmlands. (Warlord)
table.name: Warlord; Relationships and Adventures

table.caption: Dragon Encounter Complications
rows: The dragon has no interest in fighting and tries to avoid the characters, until they anger the dragon through significantly injury or insult.
The dragon is too bored to fight and offers the characters a tiny amount of treasure if they'll leave.
The dragon hates a certain type of character (sneaky rogues, healers, or heavily armored fighters, perhaps) and directs at least one attack each round at such a character.

The dragon tries to drive the characters off by emotionally hurting or humiliating them—threatening something they obviously care about, damaging their equipment, insulting them, or showing how ineffectual their attacks are.

The dragon has a way to call for help hidden deep inside the lair, such as a magic horn that summons minions, an {@item iron flask} with a powerful Fiend inside, or a magic portal to an echo's lair. The characters must prevent the dragon from summoning aid or face a new threat.
The dragon is desperately trying to protect a particular treasure, one or more eggs, or perhaps a minion, bargaining to protect this treasure and flying into a rage if it is harmed.
The previous occupant of the dragon's lair left behind a curse, a trap, or a lingering spirit that clever characters can turn against the dragon.
The dragon's lair is almost impossible to navigate without access to one or more of the dragon's special movement modes (typically flight, but possibly burrowing, swimming, or climbing).

It's been so long since anyone has dared to intrude on the dragon's lair that the dragon is more interested in showing off the lair—and impressive lair actions—than in doing serious harm to the characters. If the characters escape and spread stories of the dragon's grandeur, so much the better.
When the dragon is agitated, the regional effects that alter the terrain around the lair create visible changes around the dragon each round.
Factions and grudges within the ranks of the dragon's minions erupt when the characters challenge the dragon, resulting in infighting that might tip the odds in the main battle in either direction.

A feature in the dragon's lair has an unpredictable magical effect, perhaps similar to a {@item wand of wonder}, a sorcerer's {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB}, or a {@book dungeon trick|DMG|10|Random Tricks} as described in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}. The dragon avoids the feature unless the encounter is going badly, then either activates the feature or tries to goad the characters into doing so.

Spell effects and breath weapons used inside the dragon's lair cause dramatic destruction, including chasms opening up, ceilings collapsing, pillars toppling, and other effects that can damage or hinder the characters and the dragon equally.

The dragon has a rival who notices the characters approaching the dragon's lair and keeps tabs on the fight. This rival might step in to help the characters or the dragon, depending on the circumstances, or might ambush the characters when they leave the dragon's lair.
The dragon takes tremendous pleasure in adopting Humanoid form and pretending to be a minion, groveling and sniveling when intruders enter the lair and claiming that the dragon is away.
The dragon's only goal is to learn a key piece of information about the characters' larger goals and then escape.
The dragon enjoys combat, roaring in appreciation each time the characters pull off effective attacks or flashy spells. But if seriously hurt, the dragon quickly calls for a truce.
Each round of combat with the dragon, the characters catch an eerie glimpse of another world where one of the dragon's echoes is active.

The dragon has a plan to feign death in case of attack—apparently being buried in a cave-in, tumbling into a deep chasm, drowning in lava, or some similarly dramatic exit. After escaping, the dragon plots revenge.

At the same time the characters are confronting the dragon, another group of adventurers is confronting one of the dragon's echoes on another world. Halfway through the fight, either the dragons or the characters and the other adventurers switch places.
table.name: Dragon Encounters; Dragon Encounter Complications

table.caption: Cross-Purposes
rows: ...directly target one or more characters. The adventure begins when the dragon or the dragon's minions confront the characters.
...threaten a character's bond or an NPC who's important to one or more characters.
...challenge a character's ideal or exploit a flaw. The character might hear rumors of the dragon's activity, spurring them into action.
...create an opportunity for a character to pursue a personal goal.
...cause an accident or catastrophe that threatens the characters.
table.name: Dragon as Schemer; Cross-Purposes

table.caption: Lair Location
rows: The area is a climate anomaly—a cool and lush oasis in a hot desert, a balmy spring within a frozen tundra, a drifting iceberg in a warm sea, a barren waste in the midst of a verdant forest, or the like.

The area is a wild magic zone. Whenever a creature casts a spell of 1st level or higher or activates a magic item, roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}.
Natural rock formations align with celestial phenomena at particular times of the year. Stars and planets might line up with rock spires and windows on solstices and equinoxes, for example.
A dead god or titan is buried in the area.
The area is a vast crater, at the center of which is a long-buried meteorite.
A magical portal to another plane of existence releases dangerous energy—and sometimes creatures—into the area.
The area was a battlefield in an ancient war where thousands of soldiers were annihilated in a devastating magical assault.
Gravity does not function as expected in the area, which might manifest as giant floating earth motes or similar terrain.
An enormous tree—possibly the oldest living organism in the world—grows at the heart of the area.
A god left a profound impression on the site during an ancient visit to the Material Plane—perhaps a footprint, a pool of tears, or a splash of blood that has permanently infused the ground.
table.name: Dragon Lairs; Lair Location

table.caption: Hoard Linking Items
rows: The broken pieces of an artifact (such as the Rod of Seven Parts)
A set of large gemstones, each engraved with the seal of a particular nation or the symbol of a deity
Numbered volumes of an encyclopedia or comprehensive history
Statuettes depicting different kinds of dragons
Portraits of the members of a well-known historical family
Ornate nesting dolls that feature a large gemstone egg at the heart of the set
Regalia—an orb, a crown, a scepter, and so forth—belonging to a recently deposed monarch
Pieces of a full suit of armor that once belonged to an ancient hero
A set of teeth from a rival dragon, a prophet, or a rare creature
Pieces of a chess set or another board game, or cards from a deck of playing cards, a {@deck tarokka deck|CoS}, or a {@item deck of many things}
table.name: Linking Hoards; Hoard Linking Items

table.caption: Unfinished Business
rows: Entrust the haunted item to the ghost's heir
Entomb the haunted item with the ghost's corpse
Use the haunted item for a specific purpose
Reunite the haunted item with other items forming a set
Destroy the ghost's killer: a dragon who is an echo of the hoard's owner on another world
table.name: Haunted Hoards; Unfinished Business

table.caption: Hoard Curse Effects
rows: Each affected creature gains 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} that can't be removed until the curse is broken.
Each affected creature automatically fails saving throws against dragons' breath weapons and Frightful Presence.
Each affected creature gains vulnerability to the damage type of the breath weapon of the dragon who cursed the hoard.
Each affected creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet.
Affected creatures can't spend Hit Dice to regain hit points during a short rest.
When an affected creature dies, its soul becomes imprisoned by the slain dragon's spirit, preventing the creature from being raised from the dead.
table.name: A Dragon's Curse; Hoard Curse Effects

table.caption: Breaking a Hoard Curse
rows: Make an offering of blood from everyone who participated in killing the dragon (or those creatures' nearest kin)
Bathe or sprinkle the treasure in the dragon's blood
Make a sacrifice to Bahamut, Tiamat, or both
table.name: A Dragon's Curse; Breaking a Hoard Curse

table.caption: Hoard Magic
rows: Create a permanent protective ward covering a city-state or small kingdom
Destroy a large magical ward protecting a region
Create a dead magic zone where spells and magic items won't function
Repair the fabric of magic in a dead magic zone
Reassert the dominance of the Material Plane in a region, banishing influence that has been seeping in from another plane of existence
Open a portal to another plane of existence or another world of the Material Plane
table.name: Competition for a Hoard; Hoard Magic

table.caption: Coin Origins
rows: Equivalent value in {@book trade goods|PHB|5|Trade Goods} (see the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}) rather than coins
Coins from an ancient culture local to this region, ancestral to the people who live here now
Coins from an ancient culture in a distant region
Coins from a nearby contemporary culture
Coins from a local contemporary culture
table.name: Coins; Coin Origins

table.caption: Hoard Mundane Items
rows: A painting by an artist long forgotten by everyone except the dragon
A hogshead (large cask) containing 65 gallons of clean drinking water
Several embroidered throw pillows depicting wyrmling dragons
A funerary urn containing remains the dragon can't identify
A set of seven candlesticks bearing a god's holy symbol
A tarnished brazier with pleasant-smelling ash
A drum for use in religious rites, with a foreboding echo to its beat
A stuffed Monstrosity appropriate to the local terrain
The skull of a Fiend or Celestial
An hourglass filled with sparkling sand
A crude flute with a pleasing sound
Hundreds or thousands of fake coins interspersed with the real treasure
A treatise on alchemy etched on steel cylinders
The battle standard of one of the dragon's ancient foes
A sketchbook from another world of the Material Plane, depicting unfamiliar creatures and one very familiar dragon
A set of irregular polyhedral dice (with 9, 13, 25, and 34 sides)
A map showing the dragon's lair in relation to villages and other long-gone landmarks
A kneeling bench, which anyone addressing the dragon is required to use
A scroll containing a long epic poem in praise of the dragon
A star chart showing Bahamut and a one-headed Tiamat as constellations, with "Elegy for the First World" written between the stars
A small shrine with a statuette, a brazier, and an altar dedicated to a god worshiped by many of the dragon's minions
A jar with a dead illithid tadpole floating in preserving chemicals
An extensive historical record in the form of carefully knotted strings
table.name: Creating a Hoard; Hoard Mundane Items

table.caption: Hoard Art Objects
table.name: Creating a Hoard; Hoard Art Objects

table.caption: Hoard Magic Items
rows: Common minor item ({@table Magic Item Table A}*)
Uncommon minor item ({@table Magic Item Table B}*)
Rare minor item ({@table Magic Item Table C}*)
Very rare minor item ({@table Magic Item Table D}*)
Legendary minor item ({@table Magic Item Table E}*)
Uncommon major item ({@table Magic Item Table F}*)
Rare major item ({@table Magic Item Table G}*)
Very rare major item ({@table Magic Item Table H}*)
Legendary major item ({@table Magic Item Table I}*)
footnotes: *See the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}.
table.name: Creating a Hoard; Hoard Magic Items

table.caption: Amethyst Dragon Personality Traits
rows: I am never so content as when contemplating the beauty and wonders of the multiverse.
I am a sworn protector against the depredations of the Far Realm, and I will root out its corruption wherever it may arise.
What use is vast knowledge or insight if it is not shared with those who can appreciate it?
Although some are fascinated by words, I think numbers are the true foundations of creation.
To experience a thing is to truly understand it. Direct and personal experience is the most valuable form of knowledge.
I see a far more kaleidoscopic reality than you do... or than any of your selves do, really.
It is not my place to interfere. I merely seek to observe, learn, and understand.
With a true understanding of metaphysics, anything is possible—including the creation of a more orderly and perfect cosmos than this one.
table.name: Creating an Amethyst Dragon; Amethyst Dragon Personality Traits

table.caption: Amethyst Dragon Ideals
rows: Balance. Everything is a complex interaction of forces that must be kept in a delicate and carefully maintained balance. (Neutral)
Knowledge. We are the whole of creation, seeking to understand itself. (Any)
Self-Improvement. I am a complex gem, and I constantly polish and refine my many facets to make the whole that much more perfect. (Any)
Responsibility. Having knowledge and power gives one a responsibility to those who have less of either. (Lawful)
Noble Obligation. My superior experience, intellect, and insight give me a duty to mediate disputes when I can. (Good)
Power. Knowledge is power, power must be used, and I use it. Your concerns are irrelevant. (Evil)
table.name: Creating an Amethyst Dragon; Amethyst Dragon Ideals

table.caption: Amethyst Dragon Adventure Hooks
rows: An amethyst dragon seeks a rare type of crystal found in the domain of a territorial stone giant clan.
A coven of hags seeks to reclaim its hag eye, which rests within an amethyst dragon's hoard.
An amethyst dragon magically disables all teleportation within a thousand miles of their lair. Governments within that area seek emissaries who can negotiate an end to the restriction.
An amethyst dragon recruits a group of adventurers to psychically trade bodies with adventurers from another world, so that each can carry out certain tasks before swapping back.
A cult devoted to a Great Old One of the Far Realm seeks an alien monolith that can summon its master, but the site is guarded by an amethyst dragon.
An {@creature amethyst dragon wyrmling|FTD} is actually the temporally displaced form of an {@creature ancient amethyst dragon|FTD} who already exists in the same time line.
An amethyst dragon seeks the means to plant special crystals that will allow the dragon to magically coexist in multiple places at once across the world during a rare celestial alignment.
An amethyst dragon is fusing with their echoes on other worlds. They all hope to ascend to godhood, perhaps recreating or replacing Sardior.
table.name: Amethyst Dragon Adventures; Amethyst Dragon Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Amethyst Dragon Wyrmling Connections
rows: An {@creature amethyst dragon wyrmling|FTD} is in the care of a cloistered religious order of scribes.
A half-amethyst dragon cares for an {@creature amethyst dragon wyrmling|FTD} sibling after the disappearance of their dragon parent.
A {@creature Faerie Dragon (Violet)||violet faerie dragon} is the playmate and guardian of an {@creature amethyst dragon wyrmling|FTD}.
An {@creature amethyst dragon wyrmling|FTD} lives alone in a lair, cared for by a cadre of animated objects.
A cloister of {@creature Flumph||flumphs} protects an {@creature amethyst dragon wyrmling|FTD} while feeding on the wyrmling's excess psionic energy.
A circle of druids looks after an {@creature amethyst dragon wyrmling|FTD} lairing in the circle's mountain tarn.
table.name: Connected Creatures; Amethyst Dragon Wyrmling Connections

table.caption: Young Amethyst Dragon Connections
rows: A myconid community dwells in tunnels near a {@creature Young Amethyst Dragon|FTD|young amethyst dragon's} lair, and its members telepathically commune with the dragon and any visitors in the lair from time to time.
A {@creature young amethyst dragon|FTD} and a {@creature githzerai zerth} travel together, learning about the multiverse.
A {@creature young amethyst dragon|FTD} wants to take over the cavern lair of a {@creature hydra}.
A deep pool in a {@creature Young Amethyst Dragon|FTD|young amethyst dragon's} lair leads to the underground domain of an {@creature aboleth} the dragon has been seeking to eliminate.
A {@creature young amethyst dragon|FTD} and a {@creature cloud giant} regularly host each other to play strategy games.
{@creature Pegasus||Pegasi} nesting in the mountain heights are under the protection of a {@creature young amethyst dragon|FTD}.
table.name: Connected Creatures; Young Amethyst Dragon Connections

table.caption: Adult Amethyst Dragon Connections
rows: {@creature Merfolk} dwelling near an {@creature Adult Amethyst Dragon|FTD|adult amethyst dragon's} lair are under threat from {@creature sahuagin} raiders.
Clusters of {@creature Shrieker||shriekers} serve as a warning system in the tunnels of an {@creature Adult Amethyst Dragon|FTD|adult amethyst dragon's} lair.
